summary: This function creates an immutable list from another list.
returns: Return an immutable copy of the original.
example-1: module Main in execution;%0A%0A@Start%0Adefun main (args : String[]) : void%0A{%0A    val original = new LinkedList();%0A%0A    My::add(original, 100);%0A    My::add(original, 200);%0A    My::add(original, 300);%0A%0A    val derived = F::immutable(original is List);%0A    %0A    My::add(original, 400);%0A    My::add(original, 500);%0A%0A    My::add(derived, 600);%0A    My::add(derived, 700);%0A%0A    F::println(%22Original: %22 .. original);%0A    F::println(%22Derived: %22 .. derived);%0A}%0A%0Adefun add (ds : List, value : Object) : void%0A{%0A    try%0A    {%0A        ds.add(value);%0A    }%0A    catch (ex : UnsupportedOperationException)%0A    {%0A        F::println(%22Failed to Add: %22 .. value);%0A    }%0A}
